title: The Hindu Morning Digest, December 27, 2024 - The Hindu
summary:
Manmohan Singh, gentleman politician who opened up India’s economy in 1991, passes away

Date: December 27, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh passed away late on Thursday, December 26, 2024, at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences. He was 92 years old and had recently retired as a member of the Rajya Sabha.

  • Singh represented Assam in the Upper House for six terms since 1991.
  • The Finance Ministry stated that the central bank's monetary policy stance may have contributed to a slowdown in demand.
  • The BJP received ₹2,604 crore in donations in 2023-24, which is nine times more than the Congress's ₹281 crore.
  • China's Defence Ministry confirmed the comprehensive implementation of an agreement to resolve the Ladakh standoff.
  • VHP leader commented that many temple-mosque disputes could have been avoided if Hindus had Mathura and Kashi.
  • Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge criticized PM Modi for not acknowledging insulting remarks made about Dr. Ambedkar.
  • The Election Commission reported over 10.58 lakh votes were not counted or rejected in the recent Lok Sabha election.
  • Bapsi Sidhwa, a renowned novelist, passed away at the age of 86 in Houston, U.S.
  • A PIL was filed in the Supreme Court to abolish the TDS system for being arbitrary and a violation of rights.
  • A Delhi tutor was arrested for inciting protests by civil service aspirants in Patna.
  • Five Palestinian journalists were killed in an Israeli strike in Gaza.
  • North India continues to experience severe cold wave conditions, with no snow in popular tourist destinations.
  • Intermittent rains are expected in parts of northern Tamil Nadu due to a weakened weather system over the Bay of Bengal.
  • Indian women’s cricket team aims for a clean sweep against West Indies in the final ODI.

Published - December 27, 2024 06:13 am IST
newTitle: Manmohan Singh, a Gentleman's Politician, Passes Away

title: Govinda's wife Sunita Ahuja says 'we use abusive language with each other': 'Aaj tak bhi nahi lagta ki hu - TOI Etimes
summary:
Sunita Ahuja on Her Unique Relationship with Govinda: 'We Use Abusive Language with Each Other'

Publication Date: [Not specified]

Source: Times of India

Sunita Ahuja candidly discusses her unconventional marriage with Govinda, revealing that their dynamic often feels more like a friendship than a traditional husband-wife relationship.

  • Sunita refers to Govinda affectionately as 'abeey' and admits their playful exchanges often involve light-hearted insults.
  • She humorously questioned the nature of their relationship, stating, 'I still can't believe you're my husband.'
  • Sunita explained her adaptation to Govinda’s family preferences, recalling her shift from miniskirts to sarees to please his mother.
  • Govinda recently celebrated his 61st birthday by interacting with fans.
  • Earlier this year, Govinda faced an incident where he accidentally shot himself in the leg at home.
'I was getting ready to leave for a show in Kolkata. It was around 4:45-5:00 AM when the revolver fell and misfired. I felt a jhatka (shock) and then noticed… there was a fountain (of blood).' - Govinda

Sunita's openness about her marriage reflects a modern take on relationships, showcasing that love can manifest in various forms.
newTitle: Sunita Ahuja on Her Unique Relationship with Govinda: 'We Use Abusive Language with Each Other'

summary:

Source: Times Now

The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India has announced the CA final result for November 2024 today. Candidates can download their scorecards on the official ICAI website.

Key Points:

  • Final examination for Group 1 was conducted on November 3, 5, and 7, and Group 2 on November 9, 11, and 13, 2024.
  • Top rank holders include:
    • Heramb Maheshwari (84.86%) from Hyderabad, scored 508 marks.
    • Rishab Ostwal R (84.86%) from Tirupati, scored 508 marks.
    • Riya Kunjankumar Shah (83.50%) from Ahmedabad, scored 501 marks.
    • Kinjal Ajmera (82.17%) from Kolkata, scored 493 marks.
  • Minimum qualifying criteria: at least 40% in each exam/paper and 50% overall to qualify.

How to Check CA Final Result Nov 2024:

  1. Visit icai.org
  2. Click on CA Final Result 2024 link on the homepage
  3. Submit your login credentials
  4. CA Final Result 2024 will appear on the screen
  5. View and download your scorecard
  6. Keep it safe for future reference

CA Final Result Nov 2024 Pass Percentage

ICAI also releases the overall pass percentage along with results, outlining the criteria for candidates.

For more updates, visit the official website of ICAI.

title: Obituary: Manmohan Singh, a gentleman politician - The Hindu
Which infectious disease is likely to be biggest emerging problem in 2025? - The Indian Express
summary:
Which infectious disease is likely to be biggest emerging problem in 2025?

Publication Date: N/A | Source: Indian Express

The article discusses concerns among public health officials regarding emerging infectious diseases, particularly as COVID-19 recedes. It highlights the potential threat posed by the H5N1 influenza virus and compares it with ongoing threats such as malaria, HIV, and tuberculosis.

  • COVID-19 has raised awareness of the potential for new infectious diseases.
  • Malaria, HIV, and tuberculosis currently kill around 2 million people annually.
  • H5N1 bird flu is spreading among birds and recently infecting cattle in the US.
  • There has been a significant increase in human bird flu cases in 2023.
  • H5N1 has a high mortality rate in humans but does not currently spread between people.
  • A mutation could potentially enable human-to-human transmission of H5N1.
  • Governments are preparing for the possibility of a pandemic by acquiring vaccines and planning responses.
If this strain of bird flu makes that switch and can start transmitting between humans, governments must act quickly to control the spread.

The article concludes that while H5N1 poses a potential threat, existing diseases must also be prioritized in public health initiatives.
newTitle: Potential Emerging Infectious Diseases for 2025

title: Paterson, Bosch lead South Africa's Boxing Day domination - ESPNcricinfo
summary:

In a dominating performance at Centurion, South Africa showcased their bowling prowess against Pakistan, sending them packing for just 209 runs, with Dane Paterson and Corbin Bosch taking five and four wickets respectively.

  • South Africa bowled out Pakistan for 209 runs in the first innings.
  • Dane Paterson claimed 5 wickets, while Corbin Bosch took 4 wickets.
  • Kamran Ghulam was the top scorer for Pakistan with 54 runs.
  • South Africa ended the day at 82 for 3 in reply to Pakistan's first innings total.
  • Aiden Markram remained not out with 47 runs at the close of play.
'South Africa will claim this day as theirs thanks to the performances of Paterson and Bosch.'

Overall, South Africa's disciplined bowling and sensible batting have given them the upper hand going into the second day of the match.

title: How Allu Arjun's arrest over fan death turned into a political slugfest - Hindustan Times
summary:
Allu Arjun's Arrest Over Fan Death Sparks Political Controversy

Publication Date: December 5, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Allu Arjun's attendance at the screening of his film 'Pushpa 2' resulted in a tragic stampede at Sandhya Theatre, leading to his arrest and subsequent political fallout.

  • A stampede occurred on December 4, resulting in the death of a 35-year-old woman and critical injuries to her son.
  • Allu Arjun was charged with culpable homicide not amounting to murder but has since been released on bail.
  • The incident triggered political exchanges, particularly involving Telangana's CM Revanth Reddy who accused the actor of negligence.
  • Allu Arjun donated ₹2 crore to the victim’s family amidst claims of political motivation behind the accusations against him.
  • Political analysts suggest this controversy may be aimed at diminishing Allu Arjun's influence due to his connections with the BJP.
“An actor cannot be perceived as a criminal because an accident happens.”

The event drew widespread media attention, revealing the intersection of film and politics in India, particularly how a star's misfortune can become a platform for political maneuvering.
newTitle: Allu Arjun's Arrest Over Fan Death Sparks Political Controversy
